metadata.title: CVE-2019-12493 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
A stack-based buffer over-read exists in PostScriptFunction::transform inFunction.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01 because GfxSeparationColorSpace andGfxDeviceNColorSpace mishandle tint transform functions. It can, forexample, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftopstool. It might allow an attacker to cause Denial of Service or leak memorydata.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13').
emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
texlive-bin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
